bug.author: HyperGroups
bug.summary: Question: problem with import model generated by Wolfram Mathematica?
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups/MachineLearning/blob/master/mxnet/python/1.0/model-wolfram/example-symbol.json>sample_model_symbol</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups/MachineLearning/blob/master/mxnet/python/1.0/model-wolfram/example-symbol.json>sample_mode_paramsl</denchmark-link>
When I'm using load_checkpoint() I found the code in model.py is <denchmark-code>symbol = sym.load('%s-symbol.json' % prefix) save_dict = nd.load('%s-%04d.params' % (prefix, epoch)) arg_params = {} aux_params = {} for k, v in save_dict.items(): tp,name = k.split(':', 1) if tp == 'arg': arg_params[name] = v if tp == 'aux': aux_params[name] = v </denchmark-code>
the problem is in my arguments, there is no {{{___colon : ____]}} so the error info is <denchmark-code>[02:17:25] src/nnvm/legacy_json_util.cc:190: Loading symbol saved by previous version v1.0.1. Attempting to upgrade... [02:17:25] src/nnvm/legacy_json_util.cc:198: Symbol successfully upgraded! Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/hypergroups/nutstore/ProjectsOnline/My/Python/MXNet/1.0/script/test_rgb.py", line 25, in <module> sym,arg_params, aux_params = mx.model.load_checkpoint(model_prefix,0) File "/home/hypergroups/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mxnet/model.py", line 425, in load_checkpoint tp, name = k.split(':', 1) ValueError: need more than 1 value to unpack </denchmark-code>
mxnet.version is 1.1.0

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sandeep-krishnamurthy>@sandeep-krishnamurthy</denchmark-link> Could you please tag this as Question
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ankkhedia>@ankkhedia</denchmark-link> only a contributor can add labels?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups>@HyperGroups</denchmark-link> : Can you please ask the question at <denchmark-link:https://discuss.mxnet.io/>https://discuss.mxnet.io/</denchmark-link> ? More people will be able to answer and later search for the similar question. We want to keep GitHub issues mainly for bugs and feature requests. Please reopen if you face any issues.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sandeep-krishnamurthy>@sandeep-krishnamurthy</denchmark-link> hi, deer, why you don't see this as bug? user should change model.py file to make program in your official tutorial runs well. OK, thank you, I'll post my question also in discuss.mxnet.io.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups>@HyperGroups</denchmark-link> - Sorry I did not see the issue with model.py. Reopening this issue and tracking it as a Bug. Thanks.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups>@HyperGroups</denchmark-link> can you please show or point me to how you export it from Mathematica? The reason why you have this error is because only models saved using the module API or the function of in Gluon can be loaded using the function. As of 1.2.1, you can load your model in Gluon using the HybridBlock.imports function: import mxnet as mx from mxnet import gluon
net = gluon.nn.SymbolBlock.imports('example-symbol.json', ['Input'], param_file='example-0000.params', ctx=mx.cpu())

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sandeep-krishnamurthy>@sandeep-krishnamurthy</denchmark-link> can you please close the issue? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyperGroups>@HyperGroups</denchmark-link> let's continue the discussion there: <denchmark-link:https://discuss.mxnet.io/t/simple-bind-error-when-loading-model/1110/3>https://discuss.mxnet.io/t/simple-bind-error-when-loading-model/1110/3</denchmark-link>
